column1: "I've watched through his eyes, I've listened through his ears, and tell you he's the one. Or at least as close as we're going to get.”
column2: “我通过他的眼睛观察过，通过他的耳朵倾听过。我告诉你，他就是那个人——或者至少是我们能找到的最接近目标的人。”

column1: "That's what you said about the brother.”
column2: “你当初对他哥哥也是这么说的。”

column1: "The brother tested out impossible. For other reasons. Nothing to do with his ability.”
column2: “他哥哥被判定绝对不行，不过那是因为其他因素，跟他的能力没关系。”

column1: "Same with the sister. And there are doubts about him. He's too malleable. Too willing to submerge himself in someone else's will.”
column2: “他姐姐也是同样的问题。而且我们对他也有担心——这个孩子太容易被影响，太容易把自己的想法让位给别人。”

column1: "Not if the other person is his enemy.”
column2: “但要是对方是他的敌人，那就另当别论了。”

column1: "So what do we do? Surround him with enemies all the time?”
column2: “那我们要怎么做？难道要让他时时刻刻都被敌人围着？”

column1: "I thought you said you liked this kid.”
column2: “你不是说你挺喜欢这孩子的吗？”

column1: "If the buggers get him, they'll make me look like his favorite uncle.”
column2: “要是被虫族逮住了，他们会对他做的事，会让我显得好像是他最慈祥的叔叔一样。”

column1: "All right. We're saving the world, after all. Take him.”
column2: “好吧。毕竟我们是要拯救世界的。带走他吧。”

column4: “但要是对方是他的敌人，那就另当别论了。”
